video.name: JALAPENO CHILLI CORNBREAD CASSEROLE | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Jalapeno Chilli Cornbread Casserole
Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/jalapeno-chili-cornbread-casserole/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

This Jalapeno Chili Cornbread Casserole is an easy vegan comfort food casserole recipe with a quick jalapeño cheddar cornbread crust baked right on top! It’s warm and savory and comes together in one dish.

Everyone loves a good comfort food casserole and this chili cornbread casserole is especially delicious – so saucy and flavorful. It all starts out with a savory vegan lentil bean chili which is topped with an addicting maple sweetened jalapeño cornbread crust. You’ll find it difficult to stop nibbling away at that cornbread topping it’s so good with that hint of sweetness that balances out the heat from the chili and jalapenos. The cornbread is delicious and moist because of being baked on top of the chili!

Not only is it this vegan cornbread casserole hearty, but it’s also quick to pull together in one dish. You mix all the chili ingredients in the dish and pre-bake the chili, top with the cornbread mix, and pop this back in the oven until it’s all ready and bubbly.

#jalapenocornbread #cornbreadrecipe #vegancornbread #veganricha #easyveganreecipes

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup Split red lentils (use 1/3 cup if you like less lentilly chili )
15 oz can black beans or 1.5 cups cooked beans
2 cups diced canned tomatoes (or fresh tomatoes. If using fresh tomatoes, add in 1 tbsp of tomato paste as well.)
3/4 cup non-dairy milk (Such as almond , oat, soy or light coconut)
3/4 cup Medium grain cornmeal (or fine grain or grits)
1/4 to 1/3 cup of vegan cheddar shreds (or use 1-2 tbsp nutritional yeast)

recipeInstructions.text: In a 9x9 casserole dish, add all of the ingredients under "for the chili" and mix well. Add 1 1/2 cups of water and mix in, and even out the mixture
recipeInstructions.name: In a 9x9 casserole dish, add all of the ingredients under "for the chili" and mix well. Add 1 1/2 cups of water and mix in, and even out the mixture

recipeInstructions.text: Place in a pre-heated oven at 400 degrees F, and cook for 35 minutes. Meanwhile make your cornbread mixture, and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in a pre-heated oven at 400 degrees F, and cook for 35 minutes. Meanwhile make your cornbread mixture, and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all your dry ingredients, cornmeal, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cornstarch in a bowl, then add in the wet ingredients and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix all your dry ingredients, cornmeal, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and cornstarch in a bowl, then add in the wet ingredients and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in your pickled Jalapenos and cheddar shreds and mix, and let the mixture sit for five minutes to see if you need more non-dairy milk.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in your pickled Jalapenos and cheddar shreds and mix, and let the mixture sit for five minutes to see if you need more non-dairy milk.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the chili casserole out of the oven and the lentils by now should be al dente, or just about done.There should be barely any liquid in the mixture. If it's too liquidy, then bake for another 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the chili casserole out of the oven and the lentils by now should be al dente, or just about done.There should be barely any liquid in the mixture. If it's too liquidy, then bake for another 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: -Spread the cornbread mixture over the casserole, and even it out with a spatula, spread the sliced jalapenos on top.
recipeInstructions.name: -Spread the cornbread mixture over the casserole, and even it out with a spatula, spread the sliced jalapenos on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the casserole back in the oven to bake for another 25-30 minutes, check if the cornbread is done in the center and the sides are startng to turn golden, thats when the casserole is done.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the casserole back in the oven to bake for another 25-30 minutes, check if the cornbread is done in the center and the sides are startng to turn golden, thats when the casserole is done.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the casserole out and cool for 5-10 minutes, and just take large helpings and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Take the casserole out and cool for 5-10 minutes, and just take large helpings and enjoy!
